reporting-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

title.narrative: Improving the Conservation Status of Western Black Crested Gibbon in Nam Kan National Protected Area, Lao PDR

description.narrative: Conserve biodiversity and manage natural resources in ways that maintain their long-term viability and preserve their potential to meet the needs of present and future generations. Activities include combating illegal and corrupt exploitation of natural resources and the control of invasive species. Programs in this element should be integrated with the Agriculture Area under Economic Growth and Conflict Mitigation and Reconciliation Area under the Peace and Security Category, when applicable and appropriate.

This award strives to conserve biodiversity and manage natural resources in ways that maintain their long-term viability and preserve their potential to meet the needs of present and future generations. Activities include combating illegal and corrupt exploitation of natural resources and the control of invasive species. This includes The purpose of this project is to improve the understanding of the status of N. concolor in Nam Kan NPA, to support management planning and prioritize resources for the conservation of the species. This will be done by: 1) providing the necessary training to local government and NGO staff and then carrying out field surveys of the gibbons to complete the picture of the status and distribution of gibbons throughout the entire NPA; 2) assessing threats to gibbons through village interviews; 3) conducting a village awareness program; 4) engaging stakeholders where targeted responses are needed to address threats; 5) using all opportunities to engage with relevant stakeholders through informal consultations, arranged meetings, and a series of workshops and village meetings to prepare a Species Conservation Action Plan; 6) facilitating the implementation of effective law enforcement patrols through provision of SMART training to the village law enforcement patrol teams; and 7) engaging with relevant stakeholders to socialize issues relating to provincial boundary demarcation so that a workable solution may be found that removes the hindrance caused by the ambiguity of the boundary location that is hindering conservation and management of the NPA..

participating-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

participating-org.usg:office-name: Fish and Wildlife Service/Office of International Affairs

owner-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

description.narrative: The primary goal of U.S. assistance in Laos is to demonstrate that the United States is a trusted and reliable partner in the economic and social development of the country. To accomplish this, U.S. assistance programs are designed to address legacy issues arising from the war in Vietnam, support public health efforts to combat child malnutrition and improve maternal and newborn health, increase primary school graduation rates, promote legal and regulatory systems reform, combat drug flows from Laos to other countries, increase regional and global economic integration and adherence to international standards and trade agreements, and strengthen people-to-people ties between Laos and the United States. U.S. assistance promotes good governance and respect for human rights; more sustainable country-based health and education systems; a legal framework that provides greater access to U.S. businesses and facilitates inclusive growth; the removal of unexploded ordnance; and a positive, constructive relationship between Laos and the United States.
